title: Court Rules Most Trump Tariffs Illegal, Exceeding Authority
snippets: The U.S. Court of Appeals for the Federal Circuit in Washington, D.C., delayed enforcing its decision, which is expected to be appealed to the Supreme Court.
The tariffs can remain in place until mid-October to allow the Trump administration time to request the Supreme Court take up the case.
But the court has allowed the tariffs to remain in place while the Trump administration appeals to the Supreme Court.
A US appeals court ruled that most tariffs imposed by President Donald Trump are illegal. The Trump administration has said it will appeal the ruling to the Supreme Court.
A federal appeals court has ruled that most of President Donald Trump’s sweeping global tariffs are unlawful.
Judges uphold ruling that the president exceeded his authority

Ruling upholds decision from trade court while president attacks ‘Highly Partisan Appeals Court’ and says he will win tariff fight

  • Full story: Most of Trump tariffs illegal, court fin
The decision is a big blow to President Trump’s trade policies, but the judges left the duties in place for now to allow time for a likely appeal to the Supreme Court.

Trump found to have overstepped authority with tariff policies as president accuses court of political bias

Donald Trump overstepped his presidential powers with most of his globe-rattling
The U.S. Court of Appeals for the Federal Circuit in Washington, D.C., in a split decision, said Trump exceeded his authority as president by imposing the tariffs.
A federal appeals court struck down President Donald Trump's sweeping tariff plan, ruling that he overstepped his executive power.

Most of President Donald Trump’s global tariffs were ruled illegal by a federal appeals court that found he exceeded his authority by imposing them through an emergency law, but the judges let the levies stay in place while the case proceeds.

WASHINGTON (AP) — A federal appeals court ruled Friday that President Donald Trump had no legal right to impose sweeping tariffs but left in place for now his effort to build a protectionist wall around the American economy. The U.S. Court of Appeals for the Federal Circuit ruled Trump wasn’t legall
The appeals court stayed its ruling until Oct. 14, giving the Trump administration time to ask the Supreme Court to hear the case.
titles: Most of President Trump's tariffs are illegal, U.S. court rules
US court rules many of Trump's global tariffs are illegal
US appeals court rules Trump’s foreign tariff campaign is largely illegal
US President Trump's sweeping tariffs largely illegal, but can stay in place for now, appeals court rules
Trump’s global tariffs are unlawful, appeals court says
Trump’s tariffs ruled illegal by US appeals court but stay in place
US appeals court rules most of Trump’s sweeping global tariffs illegal – live
Trump’s Sweeping Tariffs Invalidated by Appeals Court
Most of Trump’s tariffs are illegal, federal court rules
Trump’s tariffs on Canada, other countries are illegal: U.S. appeals court
Trump's global tariffs are illegal, federal court rules. Here's why they'll remain in place.
Trump’s Global Tariffs Found Illegal by US Appeals Court
U.S. federal appeal’s court rules Trump’s tariffs on Canada, other countries, illegal but leaves them in place for now
Most Trump tariffs ruled illegal by appeals court, dealing major blow to trade policy
summary: A U.S. federal appeals court ruled that most of the tariffs imposed by President Donald Trump are illegal, stating he exceeded his authority. The decision, which upholds a trade court's ruling, is based on violations of a 1977 law and the U.S. Constitution. Although the tariffs remain in effect temporarily to allow time for an expected appeal, the outcome represents a significant challenge to Trump's trade policies. The Supreme Court is anticipated to review the case following the appeal.

title: Trump Revokes Kamala Harris' Extended Secret Service Protection
snippets: It's typical that former vice presidents have Secret Service protection for 6 months after leaving office. In Harris' case, she had received an extension of her detail. Trump is ending the extension.
Move comes as spectre of political violence has grown in the US, with Trump facing two campaign assassination attempts.
Former president Joe Biden had signed an order to provide protection for Kamala Harris through July 2026. It comes as Harris will embark on public appearances to promote her memoir.

<a href="https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMihAFBVV95cUxQaW9yU1cxUXZJVXpZN3BKa2FueFduTXljSFR6RlQxWU5qb0x5V0xPLW9sb1ZENEMzOHdtXzR3cGU1M3p0cVhQbzJPSnV2YWNTbHUwblZVRlBwajVQMkM3LXJyWnRtU21vTzhkTDdVUHdzS2p3MVlrTFlNRFhSa3h6V2RnQmE?oc=5" target="_blank">Trump ends Kamala Harris' Secret Service protect

President’s new security directive cancels one-year extension signed by Biden before leaving office

Donald Trump has revoked Secret Service protection for the forme
titles: Trump ends Harris' Secret Service detail
Trump revokes Secret Service detail for political opponent Kamala Harris
Trump revokes Kamala Harris' Secret Service protection
Trump ends Kamala Harris' Secret Service protections - Axios
Trump revokes Kamala Harris’s Secret Service detail extended by Biden
summary: Former Vice President Kamala Harris' extended Secret Service protection, initially authorized by President Joe Biden until July 2026, has been revoked by Donald Trump. This decision comes despite the increasing political violence in the US, including two assassination attempts on Trump's campaign. Harris was set to have enhanced security as she planned public appearances to promote her memoir.

title: US Blocks Palestinian President from UN General Assembly Attendance
snippets: The decision comes as France leads international efforts to recognise a Palestinian state at the UN meeting next month.

<a href="https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMihgFBVV95cUxOZGV4bUNVVGFaRWxOV3hYTVBrOFpPN0FMTjZEcV8yYmlyVlU0eEFFUUl5czBueGotR0ZHRnpTclpjRkVkcXJxWHVwUjhEX2VibWkwN3hZYkRjbFFiYUpoQlVGTnhyZFpmTTZSS1NrQWZGMDE1U204M3pJTUktVXpBbU1fdjh0Zw?oc=5" target="_blank">U.S. blocks Palestinian president from attend
Trump administration extends visa ban to include authority’s president
The United States generally allows foreign officials to attend the United Nations General Assembly. The administration’s move comes amid a new push for Palestinian statehood.
titles: US blocks Palestinian leader from attending UN meeting in New York
U.S. blocks Palestinian president from attending UN General Assembly - Axios
US bars Palestinian leader Abbas from UN meeting to recognise state
Trump Administration Bars Palestinian Officials From U.N. Meeting in New York
summary: The United States has blocked the Palestinian president from attending the UN General Assembly next month, amid efforts led by France to recognize a Palestinian state. This decision marks a significant move by the U.S. administration, contrasting with the general practice of allowing foreign officials to attend the assembly.

title: U.S. Denies Visas to PLO, PA Members Amid Palestinian ICC Appeals
snippets: Palestine’s UN envoy Riyad Mansour said Washington’s visa ban on Palestinian officials threatens to bar Mahmoud Abbas.
State Dept cites Palestinian appeals to ICC and ICJ over Israeli abuses in occupied territory in justifying move.
The move comes as U.S. allies prepare to recognize Palestinian statehood next month.

Step comes when France is leading a push to recognise Palestinian state after Israel’s unyielding bombing of Gaza

The US has begun denying and revoking visas from members of the Palestine Liberation Organization (PLO) and the Palestinian Authority (PA) in advance of the UN general assembly

The Trump administration said it will deny visas to Palestinian Authority President Mahmoud Abbas and 80 other Palestinian officials in a move that will likely make it impossible for them to attend next month’s meeting of the UN General Assembly.
titles: Reaction to US visa ban on Palestinian officials ahead of UNGA
US denies visas for Palestinian officials before UN assembly
U.S. denies visas to Palestinian officials ahead of U.N. General Assembly
US denies visas to Palestinian Authority leaders for UN general assembly
US Will Deny Visas to Top Palestinian Leaders Before UN Meeting
summary: The U.S. has started denying and revoking visas for members of the Palestine Liberation Organization (PLO) and the Palestinian Authority (PA), including potentially Mahmoud Abbas, in response to Palestinian appeals to the ICC and ICJ over Israeli actions in occupied territories. This move coincides with efforts by U.S. allies, led by France, to recognize Palestinian statehood following Israel's bombing of Gaza.

title: Spirit Airlines Files for Bankruptcy Again Amid Financial Struggles
snippets: Spirit Airlines filed for bankruptcy protection again, just months after the budget carrier came out of Chapter 11 protection earlier this year.

Low-cost carrier experiences dwindling cash and mounting losses as recovery further hit by Trump tariffs

US no-frills pioneer Spirit Airlines filed for fresh chapter 11 bankruptcy protection on Friday, as dwindling cash and mounting losses derailed its turnaround efforts since emerging fro
Spirit Airlines on Friday filed for bankruptcy for the second time in a year. The discount airline warned in early August it may not survive the year.
The move comes after the budget airline emerged from bankruptcy in March.
titles: Spirit Airlines files for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection for the second time in a year
Spirit Airlines files for bankruptcy protection for second time in a year
Spirit just filed for bankruptcy .... again
Spirit Airlines files for bankruptcy again, has this to say about its Labor Day flights
summary: Spirit Airlines has filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection for the second time within a year, citing dwindling cash reserves and increasing losses exacerbated by Trump tariffs. Despite emerging from a previous bankruptcy in March, the low-cost carrier has struggled to recover, leading to this latest filing. Spirit intends to continue operating normally during the restructuring process, allowing passengers to book flights as usual.

title: Trump Administration Targets Wind Industry Funding, Calls Projects Wasteful
snippets: The wind industry has been in President Donald Trump's crosshairs since his first day in office, but his administration has recently escalated its attacks.
The Trump administration’s campaign against wind power continued as it targeted funding for marine terminals and ports to support development of the industry.
“Wasteful wind projects are using resources that could otherwise go towards revitalizing America’s maritime industry,” Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy said.
titles: Trump administration cancels $679 million for offshore wind projects
Transportation Dept. Cancels $679 Million for Offshore Wind Projects
Trump breaks wind funding again, canceling $679 million in federal funding for a dozen offshore projects
summary: Since taking office, President Trump's administration has criticized the wind industry, recently intensifying efforts by targeting funding for marine terminals and ports aimed at supporting the sector. Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy labeled these wind projects as wasteful, arguing the resources should be used to rejuvenate America’s maritime industry instead.

title: Taylor Swift Debuts Engagement Ring at Game, Sparks Wedding Buzz
snippets: From dress(es) to secret plans, experts share their predictions for America's wedding of the century.

Taylor Swift made her first public appearance wearing her engagement ring from Travis Kelce at the Cincinnati Bearcats and Nebraska Cornhuskers game Thursday night at Arrowhead Stadium in Kansas City.

<a href="https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMikAFBVV95cUxQTjJiYVZrNklqZ3VaM0E5OGVYY1ZRTHpfUEh3eXNaSWJFVWRkM0Y1V1hZbmkxR1lDV0xYdmszT1hYa3ZyX1VjQk44eVVXUmljRFp5Tzc4WUpoZHB6TmdYTU1QWTRDQXh2eEJzaUxEb3N4cmJ3SkJMOGtUak9Pd1VWY29ua1IzYWtIQmhqMmllR1g?oc=5" target="_blank">Taylor Swift Watching College Fo
titles: What Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce's wedding could look like
WATCH:  Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce spotted at college football game after engagement
Taylor Swift Watching College Football With Travis Kelce Led to So Many Jokes - Sports Illustrated
summary: Taylor Swift was seen wearing her engagement ring from Travis Kelce for the first time in public at the Cincinnati Bearcats vs. Nebraska Cornhuskers game at Arrowhead Stadium in Kansas City. This appearance fueled speculation about their upcoming wedding, dubbed "America's wedding of the century" by some.

title: Paetongtarn Shinawatra Dismissed as Thailand PM Amid Scandal
snippets: Paetongtarn Shinawatra was dismissed after a leaked phone call scandal.

Daughter of former PM Thaksin accused of failing to protect country’s interests over leaked phone call with Cambodia’s leader

Thailand’s constitutional court has dismissed Paetongtarn Shinawatra from her position as prime minister, ruling that as the country’s leader she violated ethical ru
Paetongtarn Shinawatra became the third member of her family to be removed from the job, as the nation plunged into fresh political instability.
titles: What next for Thailand after court sacks suspended prime minister?
Thai court dismisses prime minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra
Thai Court Dismisses Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra From Office
summary: Paetongtarn Shinawatra was dismissed as Thailand's Prime Minister by the constitutional court for failing to protect the country's interests, following a scandal involving a leaked phone call with Cambodia's leader. This makes her the third member of her family to be removed from office, leading to renewed political instability in Thailand.

title: Court Blocks Trump's Bid to End TPS for 600,000 Venezuelans
snippets: Court rules against Trump push to cancel TPS for Venezuelans, keeping protections intact amid ongoing legal battles.

Appellate panel upholds lower court’s ruling as homeland security spokesperson attacks ‘activist’ judges

A federal appeals court on Friday blocked Donald Trump’s plans to end protections for 600,000 people from Venezuela who have
Around 350,000 Venezuelans’ legal protections ended in April, while protections for another 250,000 will expire in early September as the case continues to play out.
titles: Court blocks Trump effort to end protected status for Venezuelans
Court blocks Trump bid to end protections for 600,000 Venezuelans
Appeals Court Blocks Trump From Ending Temporary Protections For 600,000 Venezuelan Immigrants—For Now
summary: A federal appeals court has blocked Donald Trump's attempt to end Temporary Protected Status (TPS) for 600,000 Venezuelans, maintaining their protections amid ongoing legal disputes. The court's decision upholds a lower court's ruling, despite criticism from a homeland security spokesperson towards the judges involved. This ruling comes as legal protections for 350,000 Venezuelans ended in April, with an additional 250,000 at risk of losing their status by early September.

title: Amorim's Future Uncertain After Emotional Comments Post-EFL Cup Loss
snippets: Manchester United were dumped out of the EFL Cup on Wednesday by fourth-tier Grimsby and are yet to win this season.

• ‘Sometimes I love them … this is my way of doing things’

  • United accept bid for Antony and agree loan for Højlund

Ruben Amorim admits his temperament means that on some days he “hates” his players and wants to quit and that on others he loves his squad and fe
Ruben Amorim has admitted that "sometimes I want to quit, sometimes I want to be here for 20 years" and blamed his emotions for his post-match comments after Wednesday's defeat to Grimbsy.
titles: Man Utd’s Amorim sometimes ‘hates his players and wants to quit’
Amorim admits he sometimes ‘hates’ United players and some days ‘wants to quit’
Amorim: Sometimes I want to stay for years... sometimes I want to quit
summary: Ruben Amorim attributed his post-match comments to his emotions after Manchester United's EFL Cup defeat to fourth-tier Grimsby, raising questions about his future. He expressed fluctuating feelings towards his team, from wanting to quit to desiring a long tenure. Amidst this, Manchester United accepted a bid for Antony and agreed on a loan for Højlund. Despite the team's lack of wins this season and the pressure on his role, Amorim is taking it "day by day."

title: Cowboys Trade Parsons to Packers, Maintain Title Hopes
snippets: A day after the Cowboys traded star pass rusher Micah Parsons to the Packers, head coach Brian Schottenheimer says Dallas' team goals of competing for a championship "haven't changed."
First-year Dallas Cowboys head coach Brian Schottenheimer doesn't want his team to skip a beat after Thursday's trade.
titles: Goals 'haven't changed,' says Cowboys coach
Cowboys' Brian Schottenheimer addresses players after Micah Parsons trade: 'Our team goals haven't changed'
summary: The Dallas Cowboys traded star pass rusher Micah Parsons to the Green Bay Packers. Despite this, Cowboys' first-year head coach Brian Schottenheimer stated the team's championship aspirations remain unchanged.

title: Jakarta Protests Erupt After Motorcyclist Killed by Police Vehicle
snippets: A 21-year-old motorcycle taxi driver was killed near a protest hotspot around the parliament building in Jakarta when he was run over by an armored police vehicle.

Government faces calls for police reform amid violent clashes across Jakarta and demonstrations in other cities

Hundreds of Indonesians have protested at sites across Jakarta over the death of a man hit by a police vehicle, in the first big test for Prabowo Subianto’s nearly year-old govern
Rising unemployment and inflation have driven days of demonstrations. A 21-year-old man was killed when police responded with force to a protest on Thursday.
titles: Indonesia: Protests escalate after death of demonstrator
Protests erupt in Indonesia over death of man hit by police vehicle
Protests Spread Across Indonesia After a Deadly Clash With Police
summary: A 21-year-old motorcycle taxi driver was killed in Jakarta by a police vehicle near a protest site, sparking widespread demonstrations against police brutality and calling for reform. The incident, highlighting issues of rising unemployment and inflation, marks a significant challenge for Prabowo Subianto's government. Protests have spread across Jakarta, with many Indonesians demanding accountability and change.

title: Patriots Release Safety Jabrill Peppers, Freeing Up $4.32M
snippets: The Patriots have released safety Jabrill Peppers. A nine-year veteran, Peppers has $4.32 million left on his contract.

summary: The New England Patriots have cut safety Jabrill Peppers, who had $4.32 million remaining on his contract. Peppers, a nine-year veteran, is now a free agent after being released by the team.

title: Red Sox Release Buehler, Promote Prospect Tolle to Majors
snippets: The Red Sox released veteran right-hander Walker Buehler in a series of moves Friday that included calling up top pitching prospect Payton Tolle for his major league debut.
The Boston Red Sox released veteran right-hander Walker Buehler in a series of moves Friday that included calling up top pitching prospect Payton Tolle for his major league debut.
titles: Red Sox release Buehler, call up prospect Tolle
Red Sox release RHP Walker Buehler
summary: The Boston Red Sox released veteran pitcher Walker Buehler and called up pitching prospect Payton Tolle for his major league debut as part of a series of team changes announced on Friday.

title: Ben Shelton Withdraws from US Open Due to Shoulder Injury
snippets: Ben Shelton quit during his third-round match at the US Open on Friday because of a left shoulder injury.

Ben Shelton had just acrobatically taken the third set of his US Open third-round match, getting up from a tumble to the court during the point and then throwing his left arm into the air to encourage cheers after he won it.
titles: Shelton (shoulder) retires hurt from Open match
Ben Shelton out of US Open after injuring shoulder against Mannarino
summary: Ben Shelton withdrew from his third-round match at the US Open due to a left shoulder injury. This occurred after an acrobatic play where he won the third set, despite taking a tumble and using his left arm to rally the crowd.

title: Fantasy Draft Tips: Karabell, Richard Share Insights, Chiefs Players Touted
snippets: The annual hit is back, with players Eric Karabell feels are going earlier than they should in drafts this summer.
Here's what to do -- and not do -- in a salary cap draft
Jamey's list of 10 bust candidates relative to ADP also features one key rookie he's fading
Find out why Dave Richard holds Omarion Hampton and other rookies in high regard
titles: 🏈 Fantasy football: Do Not Draft list
2025 Fantasy Football salary cap draft: When paying up for Ja'Marr Chase, Brock Bowers and others goes wrong
2025 Fantasy Football Busts 4.0: Why Saqoun Barkley heads up Jamey Eisenberg's do not draft list
2025 Fantasy Football must-draft list: Rookies abound on Dave Richard's sleeper and breakout targets
summary: Eric Karabell suggests some players are being drafted too early in fantasy football leagues. Meanwhile, Dave Richard praises rookies like Omarion Hampton, highlighting their potential value. From the ninth draft position, specific strategies were discussed. Additionally, advice was given to target four Kansas City Chiefs players in fantasy drafts, indicating their expected strong performance.

title: Dallas Mavericks Waive Olivier Maxence-Prosper to Re-Sign Danté Exum
snippets: Mavs waiving O-Max opens up a roster spot to re-sign Danté Exum
Dallas Mavericks Waive Former First-Round Draft Pick Olivier Maxence-Prosper after two seasons to get under the second apron. What's next for the 23-year-old?
titles: Mavericks waive Olivier Maxence-Prosper: Why Dallas is reportedly parting ways with 2023 first-round pick
Dallas Mavericks Waive Former First-Round Draft Pick
summary: The Dallas Mavericks have waived Olivier Maxence-Prosper, a former first-round draft pick, after two seasons with the team. This move was made to get the team under the second salary cap apron and has opened up a roster spot, which they plan to use to re-sign Danté Exum. The future for 23-year-old Maxence-Prosper remains uncertain following his release.

title: Cowboys Trade Parsons to Packers for Picks, Clark; Aim to Win Now Unchanged
snippets: Schottenheimer says the Cowboys' goals remain unchanged after the blockbuster deal

Jerry Jones says the Dallas Cowboys are still in win-now mode, despite the decision to trade star edge rusher Micah Parsons to Green Bay for two first-round draft picks and Kenny Clark, an aging defensive tackle whose production declined last season.
titles: Brian Schottenheimer addresses Micah Parsons trade, says Cowboys can't win Super Bowl 'with just one person'
Jerry Jones says Micah Parsons trade doesn’t change Cowboys’ win-now plan
summary: The Dallas Cowboys traded star edge rusher Micah Parsons to Green Bay for two first-round draft picks and defensive tackle Kenny Clark. Despite this, Jerry Jones and coach Schottenheimer affirm the team's goals to win now remain unchanged, indicating a strategic move without altering their immediate ambitions.

title: TikTok Adds Voice Messages and Image Sharing to Direct Messaging
snippets: Every platform wants to be the place you hang with friends — even Spotify as of this week — so it’s apparently time for TikTok to shore up its direct messaging feature! It told TechCrunch that over the next few weeks, all users should see voice messages and image sharing options arrive in their DMs.
The new capabilities bring TikTok’s messaging experience more in line with that of other popular social apps and services.
titles: TikTok is now letting everyone DM each other with voice memos and pictures
TikTok now lets users send voice notes and images in DMs
summary: TikTok is enhancing its direct messaging feature by introducing voice messages and image sharing options, as confirmed to TechCrunch. This update, rolling out over the next few weeks, aims to make TikTok's messaging capabilities comparable to other leading social apps.

title: Tesla Crash in Key Largo Kills One, Injures Another; Legal Battle Ensues
snippets: The Tesla collision in Key Largo, Florida, killed 22-year-old Naibel Benavides and severely injured her boyfriend, Dillon Angulo.
The company's lawyers blame the driver (who settled with the victims separately) for the crash, and the plaintiffs' lawyers for "overwhelming" the jury with "irrelevant evidence."
titles: Tesla asks for $243 million verdict to be tossed in fatal Autopilot crash suit
Tesla challenges $243 million verdict in Autopilot death trial
summary: In Key Largo, Florida, a Tesla crash resulted in the death of 22-year-old Naibel Benavides and serious injuries to Dillon Angulo. Tesla's legal team attributes the accident to the driver, who has already settled with the victims. They accuse the plaintiffs' lawyers of biasing the jury with irrelevant evidence.

title: Minouche Shafik Appointed to Boost Business and Investor Relations
snippets: Former Bank of England deputy governor will be expected to improve relations with business and international investors

Minouche Shafik quit Columbia University after controversy over anti-Israel protests on New York campus

  • Business live –
titles: Keir Starmer names Minouche Shafik as top economic adviser
Starmer names former Bank deputy governor as his chief economic adviser
summary: Minouche Shafik, former deputy governor of the Bank of England, has been appointed to a role where she is expected to enhance relations with business and international investors. This follows her resignation from Columbia University due to controversy surrounding anti-Israel protests on the campus.

title: End of "De Minimis" Exemption Sparks Concern in Retail Over New Tariffs
snippets: <a href="https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMieEFVX3lxTFBPQU9UTGIxbTBvdzV1VnBWS3JKX3U1OWtQYlUxXzZNaEE1Q1NJazI2R2M4NEdKdjNRQWRKRGVEWWgzbzJyczM1aVV4Ylc1WWthc29Icnl5Rlk0aUFHTlZ1WFY3akx6NWt3ZFMyMDlOR1pyTnp4a09kUg?oc=5" target="_blank">End of "de minimis" exemption means new tariffs on millions of pa
The de minimis exemption, an obscure trade law provision, came to an end globally on Friday, setting off a panic across the retail industry.
titles: End of "de minimis" exemption means new tariffs on millions of packages - Axios
Retail panic: What the end of the 'de minimis' exemption means for brands across the globe
summary: The global termination of the "de minimis" trade law exemption on Friday has led to widespread concern in the retail industry, as it will result in new tariffs on millions of packages.
